metadata.title: Oxidation of Methane to Synthesis Gas in a Fluidized Bed Reactor Using MgO-Based Catalysts

OXIDATIONMETHANESYNTHESISGASINAFLUIDIZEDBEDREACTORUSINGMGOBASEDCATALYSTS SANTOS A SANTOSX1996X83 SANTOSX1996X83X91 SANTOSX1996X83XA SANTOSX1996X83X91XA item S0021-9517(96)90008-1 S0021951796900081 1-s2.0-S0021951796900081 10.1006/jcat.1996.0008 272561 2015-05-01T08:45:18.889876-04:00 1996-01-01 1996-01-31 1-s2.0-S0021951796900081-main.pdf https://s3.amazonaws.com/prod-ucs-content-store-us-east/content/pii:S0021951796900081/MAIN/application/pdf/0cd2271a0c7a397b4a4c0b12eae4e582/main.pdf https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/prod-ucs-content-store-eu-west/content/pii:S0021951796900081/MAIN/application/pdf/0cd2271a0c7a397b4a4c0b12eae4e582/main.pdf main.pdf pdf true 315932 MAIN 9 1-s2.0-S0021951796900081-main_1.png https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/prod-ucs-content-store-eu-west/content/pii:S0021951796900081/PREVIEW/image/png/0f127e6d22ae53bd799651e901f2c9bd/main_1.png https://s3.amazonaws.com/prod-ucs-content-store-us-east/content/pii:S0021951796900081/PREVIEW/image/png/0f127e6d22ae53bd799651e901f2c9bd/main_1.png main_1.png png 90736 849 656 IMAGE-WEB-PDF 1 YJCAT 90008 S0021-9517(96)90008-1 10.1006/jcat.1996.0008 Academic Press Regular Article Oxidation of Methane to Synthesis Gas in a Fluidized Bed Reactor Using MgO-Based Catalysts A. Santos a M. Menéndez a A. Monzón a J. Santamaria a E.E. Miró b E.A. Lombardo b a Department of Chemical and Environmental Engineering, University of Zaragoza, 50009, Zaragoza, Spain b Instituto de Investigaciones en Catálisis y Petroquı́mica, INCAPE (FIQ-UNL-CONICET), Santiago del Estero, 2829-3000, Santa Fe, Argentina Ni(15%)/MgO and Co(12%)/MgO have been used as catalysts to carry out the oxidation of methane to synthesis gas in a fluidized-bed reactor. The fresh and used catalysts have been characterized through a battery of instrumental techniques aiming at finding the relationship among the operating conditions, activity, and stability of the reacting system. The fresh catalysts are made up of a mixture of crystalline MgO and MgMO2(M= Ni or Co) while the used ones also contain NiO and CoO. This explains the on-stream activation of the solid in terms of anin situreduction of the oxides to generate the metallic centers needed to catalyze the reforming reaction. Under some of the experimental conditions employed, the SEM micrographs of the used solids show coke formation in whiskers. These will be burnt in the oxidizing zone of the fluidized bed, thus releasing Ni particles, which may be deposited on the freeboard walls. These metallic particles can catalyze back reactions, decreasing the overall yield to the desired reaction products, CO and H2.

coredata.dc:description: Ni(15%)/MgO and Co(12%)/MgO have been used as catalysts to carry out the oxidation of methane to synthesis gas in a fluidized-bed reactor. The fresh and used catalysts have been characterized through a battery of instrumental techniques aiming at finding the relationship among the operating conditions, activity, and stability of the reacting system. The fresh catalysts are made up of a mixture of crystalline MgO and MgMO2(M= Ni or Co) while the used ones also contain NiO and CoO. This explains the on-stream activation of the solid in terms of anin situreduction of the oxides to generate the metallic centers needed to catalyze the reforming reaction. Under some of the experimental conditions employed, the SEM micrographs of the used solids show coke formation in whiskers. These will be burnt in the oxidizing zone of the fluidized bed, thus releasing Ni particles, which may be deposited on the freeboard walls. These metallic particles can catalyze back reactions, decreasing the overall yield to the desired reaction products, CO and H2.
coredata.dc:title: Oxidation of Methane to Synthesis Gas in a Fluidized Bed Reactor Using MgO-Based Catalysts
